translations.home.page.foot.technique: Technology Supported by Angular and PrimeNG
translations.main.page.drawer.title: PREFERENCE
translations.home.page.func.part.title: SORTING ALGORITHMS
translations.home.page.func.part.subtitle: There are about 50 sorting algorithms exsiting in this platform. These algorithms are either conventional or unconventional in general. Furthermore, Some of these conventional algorithms are classified into one of comparison, distribution, hybrid, and parallel network.
translations.home.page.intro.part.title: INTRODUCTIONS
translations.home.page.intro.part.subtitle: This website is a visual platform for the process of sorting algorithms. All soring algorithms are written by Typescript. In addition, it also displays visual results of each sorting algorithm, and users can understand advantages and disadvantages by a comparison of each sorting algorithm intuitively.
translations.home.page.intro.part.content.how.1: This platform offers a canvas to display the precess and the result of each sorting algorithm.
translations.home.page.intro.part.content.how.2: The entire process is presented by each column aligned one by one, just like histogram.
translations.home.page.intro.part.content.how.3: There is a canvas displaying visualization of the process and result of each sorting algorithm, just like a histogram.
translations.home.page.intro.part.content.how.4: User only need to setup necessary parameters by relevant controllers, and then click button 'Run' to run a sorting task.
translations.home.page.intro.part.content.what.1: This is a web base platform of visualization of sorting algorithms.
translations.home.page.intro.part.content.what.2: Users can explicitly understand how an unsorted array can be sorted by any sorting algorithm.
translations.home.page.intro.part.content.which.1: There includes conventional and unconventional sorting algorithms.
translations.home.page.intro.part.content.which.2: Conventional sorting algorithms include Bubble-Sort, Selection-Sort, Insertion-Sort, Quick-Sort, Merge-Sort, etc.
translations.home.page.intro.part.content.which.3: Unconventional sorting algorithms include Bogo-Sort, Slow-Sort, Pancake-Sort, Gnome-Sort, Stooge-Sort, etc.
translations.home.page.intro.part.content.who.1: Any people can use it to learn sorting algorithms, unless they have permissions.
translations.home.page.intro.part.content.who.2: This platform will assign a valid token for each user at random.
translations.home.page.intro.part.content.who.3: After that token pasted and validated, users can use and enjoy sorting algorithms.
translations.home.page.tech.part.title: TECHNOLOGIES SUPPORTED
translations.home.page.tech.part.subtitle: This project is developped by Angular and PrimeNG, and built by Webpack at last.
translations.home.page.tech.part.content.angular.1: Angular lets you start small on a well-lit path and supports you as your team and apps grow.
translations.home.page.tech.part.content.angular.2: Join the millions of developers all over the world building with Angular in a thriving and friendly community.
translations.home.page.tech.part.content.angular.3: Rely on Angular's built-in hydration, internationalization, security, and accessibility support to build fro everyone around the world.
translations.home.page.tech.part.content.primeng.1: PrimeNG is a next-gen suite of Open-Source UI library for Angular.
translations.home.page.tech.part.content.primeng.2: There are over 200 million downloads at present.
translations.home.page.tech.part.content.primeng.3: PrimeNG provides powerful customization of theme and many awesome UI components, which makes development for webpages much easier.
translations.home.page.tech.part.content.primeng.4: PrimeNG is the best choice for Angular, rather than other Open-Source UI libraries based on Angular.
translations.home.page.tech.part.content.webpack.1: At its core, webpack is a static module bundler for modern JavaScript applications.
translations.home.page.tech.part.content.webpack.2: When webpack processes your application, it internally builds a dependency graph from one or more entry points and then combines every module your project needs into one or more bundles, which are static assets to serve your content from.
